skill.name: backlink-analyzer
skill.description: Use when the user asks to "analyze backlinks", "check link profile", "find toxic links", "link building opportunities", "off-page SEO", "who links to me", "I have spammy links", "how do I get more backlinks", or "disavow links". Analyzes backlink profiles to understand link authority, identify toxic links, discover link building opportunities, and monitor competitor link acquisition. Essential for off-page SEO strategy. For internal link analysis, see internal-linking-optimizer. For competitor link profiles, see competitor-analysis.
skill.summary: AI-powered SEO skill for analyzing backlink profiles, identifying toxic links, discovering link building opportunities, and monitoring competitor link strategies.
skill.author: aaron-he-zhu

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure markdown documentation file providing SEO guidance templates. All 115 static findings are false positives: backtick patterns are template examples, network URLs are documentation links, path traversals are markdown relative paths, and 'system reconnaissance' flagged standard SEO competitor analysis. No actual code execution, network requests, or filesystem operations occur.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Ruby/Shell Backtick Execution
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner detected backtick patterns in markdown code blocks showing template examples. These are instructional templates (e.g., 'Analyze backlink profile for [domain]'), not actual shell execution.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Code blocks are template examples, not executable code. No shell commands are invoked.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Hardcoded URLs
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner detected hardcoded URLs in documentation. These are example URLs and reference links in markdown content, not network requests made by the skill.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Skill does not make network requests. URLs are documentation links and template examples.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Path Traversal Sequences
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner detected '..' sequences in markdown relative paths. These are documentation navigation links, not filesystem operations.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Paths like '../../research/keyword-research/' are markdown links to related skills, not filesystem access.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner flagged references to cryptographic terms (MD5) in context of SEO link analysis. No actual cryptographic operations are performed.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Skill contains no cryptographic code. References to MD5 are in discussion of link fingerprinting concepts.

dangerous_patterns.title: False Positive: System Reconnaissance
dangerous_patterns.description: Scanner flagged competitor domain analysis and backlink research as 'system reconnaissance'. This is standard SEO practice, not malicious reconnaissance.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: Analyzing competitor backlinks is legitimate SEO work. No scanning of systems without authorization occurs.

content.user_title: Analyze Backlinks and Find Link Building Opportunities
content.value_statement: This skill helps SEO professionals analyze backlink profiles to identify toxic links, discover link building opportunities, and monitor competitor strategies. It provides templates and frameworks for comprehensive off-page SEO analysis.
actual_capabilities: Analyze complete backlink profiles with authority metrics and quality scores
Identify toxic or harmful links that may trigger Google penalties
Discover link building opportunities through competitor gap analysis
Generate disavow file recommendations for Google Search Console
Compare backlink profiles across multiple competitor domains
Track link velocity and identify new/lost link trends
limitations: Requires external backlink data from tools like Ahrefs, Moz, or Semrush
Does not actually collect backlink data - provides analysis frameworks
No direct API integration - works with user-provided data exports
Cannot access live backlink databases without user-provided credentials

use_cases.title: Audit Client Backlink Profiles
use_cases.description: SEO agencies can use this skill to audit client backlink profiles, identify toxic links, and prepare disavow recommendations.

use_cases.title: Find Link Building Opportunities
use_cases.description: Identify sites linking to competitors but not your domain, prioritize high-authority prospects, and generate outreach strategies.

use_cases.title: Monitor Competitor Link Strategies
use_cases.description: Track competitor backlink acquisition, analyze their link sources, and discover gaps in your own link building efforts.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Backlink Profile Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the backlink profile for [domain]. Include total links, referring domains, domain authority, dofollow ratio, and identify any toxic links.

prompt_templates.title: Toxic Link Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Check for toxic backlinks on [domain]. Identify high-risk links, explain why they are problematic, and provide domains to consider for disavow.

prompt_templates.title: Competitor Link Gap Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Find link building opportunities by analyzing [competitor1], [competitor2], and [competitor3]. Show which sites link to them but not to my domain.

prompt_templates.title: Full Backlink Report Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive backlink analysis report for [domain] including profile overview, quality assessment, toxic link analysis, competitive comparison, and recommended actions.

output_examples.output:
## Backlink Profile Overview

**Domain:** example.com
**Referring Domains:** 1,200
**Domain Authority:** 45
**Dofollow Ratio:** 72%

### Key Findings
- Profile health score: 78/100
- Toxic link percentage: 4% (healthy)
- Top anchor: brand name (35%)

### Recommended Actions
1. Continue current link building strategy
2. Monitor exact match anchor ratio
3. Quarterly toxic link review

output_examples.input: Find link building opportunities by analyzing competitor1.com, competitor2.com
output_examples.output:
## Link Intersection Opportunities

### Sites Linking to Both Competitors (Not You)

| Domain | DA | Opportunity |
|--------|-----|-------------|
| g2.com | 91 | High - Get reviewed |
| entrepreneur.com | 92 | High - Pitch guest post |

### Top Priority Prospects
1. G2.com - Submit product for review
2. Entrepreneur.com - Contribute article

best_practices: Use quality metrics over quantity - one DA 80 link beats ten DA 20 links
Monitor backlink profiles regularly to catch toxic links early
Disavow only clearly toxic links after manual review
anti_patterns: Disavowing all low-DA links without manual review - harms legitimate links
Focusing only on quantity instead of authority and relevance
Building links too quickly - unnatural velocity triggers penalties

faq.question: What data do I need to provide?
faq.answer: Export your backlink data from Ahrefs, Moz, or Semrush as CSV. Include source domains, anchor text, link type, and authority metrics.

faq.question: Can this skill collect backlink data automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides analysis frameworks and templates. You must provide the backlink data from your preferred SEO tool.

faq.question: How do I identify toxic links?
faq.answer: Use the Link Quality Scoring Matrix in the skill. Check for PBN links, paid links without nofollow, exact match anchors from low-quality sites, and foreign language spam.

faq.question: When should I disavow links?
faq.answer: Only disavow after manual review confirms clear risks: obvious PBNs, paid links you cannot remove, or spam attacks. Disavowing too aggressively can hurt rankings.

faq.question: How often should I analyze backlinks?
faq.answer: Monthly for active sites. Quarterly for stable profiles. After any significant link building campaign or if you notice ranking drops.

faq.question: Does this work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Simply invoke the skill when you need backlink analysis assistance.
